intro: Umbilicus chrysanthus, commonly known as the golden umbilic, is a rare and striking plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often showy blooms. The plant features a distinctive central stem with whorled leaves that resemble a spiral, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Umbilicus chrysanthus is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or alpine regions.
